duties_responsibilities.duty: Oversee tax compliance and reporting functions for California-based operations, including federal, state, and local tax filings.
Collaborate with international teams and headquarters in China to ensure alignment with global tax strategies and local tax laws.
Develop and implement tax planning strategies and optimization initiatives for cross-border transactions and transfer pricing.
Manage the timely submission of all tax returns and informational reporting, while monitoring changes in tax laws and regulations.
Lead efforts to resolve tax-related issues, audit, and review, ensuring effective communication with all relevant stakeholders.
Support and administer finance-related matters, banking liaison, and credit card management for the US company.

education_certification.credential: Bachelor’s degree in Accounting, Finance, or a related field.
US CPA or tax equivalent qualification.
Prior working experience at reputable Big 4 accounting firms is preferred.
Fluent Mandarin is preferred but not mandatory.
Familiarity with international taxation and cross-border transactions is an asset.
Excellent communication skills to effectively collaborate with colleagues at various locations.
